descript.abstract: United States Airport Runways, 2008 is line theme representing airport runways in the United States and US territories. Attributei information includes information on the physical characteristics of the runways. The 6073 runways in the dataset are runways associated with the 20347 airports in the companion airport data set. This geospatial data is derived from the FAA's National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Data Product (Effective 18 January 2008).
descript.purpose: This data provides users with information about the runway locations and attributes for national and regional analysis applications.

cntorgp.cntorg: Federal Aviation Administration (Aeronautical Information Services, ATA-100)

idinfo.datacred: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) develops and maintains the textual data from which this geospatial layer was derived.

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

attracc.attraccr: Data were obtained from the Federal Aviation Administration's (FAA) National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Data. This product was published by the Aeronautical Information Services with an Effective Date of 18 January 2008.

dataqual.logic:
All linear features in this data set are straight lines. ID is the unique identifier for each record in the dataset. There may be more than one runway (ID) located at a single airport. Airports can be individually identified by the landing facility location identifier (LOCID) or by the site number (SITENO) attribute.
RITA/BTS quality checks were to cross reference the place dataset with the state dataset, to determine that the spatial data and attribute data were accurate
dataqual.complete: Landing facilities in this database consist of those identified in the NFDC 5527 database to be either publicly owned, or privately owned but open to the public, or owned by the U.S. military. The following landing facilities have been excluded: private landing facilities not open to the public, glider ports and ultra light landing facilities, as well as landing facilities that do not have a current LOCID assigned to them.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is based on coordinate data provided in the FAA National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Dataset (Effective 18 January 2008). These coordinate data identify the approximate location of the Airport Reference Point (ARP) as reported by the landing facility on the NFDC (National Flight Data Center) 5010 form. According to NFDC guidelines, the location of the ARP should be reported to a horizontal accuracy of one arc second of latitude and longitude. However, the accuracy of these reported coordinates are not verified by FAA.

citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

srcinfo.srccontr: Data were obtained from the Federal Aviation Administration's (FAA) National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Data. This product was published by the Aeronautical Information Services with an Effective Date of 18 January 2008.

procstep.procdesc: The creation of this geospatial data layer was completed by RITA/BTS in February 2008. This geopackage was derived from textual data on the FAA National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Data CDROM, effective 18 January 2008. The Apt.txt file was converted into three files using the UNIX command grep. The runway table structure was built in Oracle that followed the structure of the facility runway data described in the Apt_rf.txt file. A control file was built for the desired runway data structure and SQL Loader was used to load the data into the database. The degrees, minutes, and seconds' columns were converted into decimal degrees and ESRI products were used to create the runway linear dataset.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

enttyp.enttypd: Runways of the United States and its territories in GIS format.
enttyp.enttypds: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
A unique 3-4 character identifier assigned to the landing facility (i.e. airport).
A unique identifying number followed by an asterisk and the 'landing facility type' code. The SITE_NO forms the key to the airport records in the NFDC (5010) database. Example: 04508.*A

codesetd.codesetn: List of Official Airport Site Numbers

attr.attrdef: Official name of the runway's airport.
Airport's associated state or territory name.

codesetd.codesetn: Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas of the United States, and Associated Areas, FIPS 5-2.
codesetd.codesets: U.S. Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: Runway unique identification code. For example: 01/19; 18L/36R (parallel runways); H1 (helipad); N/S (north/south); ALL/WAY (sealane); B1 (baloonport).
The physical runway length, to the nearest foot. (Ex. 3500)
The physical runway width, to the nearest foot. (Ex. 100)

Runway surface type and condition. (NOTE 1: Surface type can have one entry or a combination of two entries when the runway is composed of distinct sections.) (NOTE 2: The surface type is optionally followed by a condition indicator: G=Good Condition, F=Fair Condition, P=Poor Condition. Some valid examples for this attribute: ASPH-CONC, ASPH-F, ASPH-CONC-G)

edom.edomvd: Pierced steel planking; landing mats; membranes
Oiled; soil cement or lime stabilized
Gravel; cinders; crushed rock; coral or shells; slag

attr.attrdef: Runway Surface treatment
Pavement Classification Number (PCN): A rating system that expresses the relative load carrying capacity of a pavement in terms of a standard single wheel load.
Runway lights edge intensity
The 2-character FIPS code of the State or State equivalent

codesetd.codesetn: Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas of the United States, and Associated Areas, FIPS 5-2.
codesetd.codesets: U.S. Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: Runway state post office code

codesetd.codesetn: List of Official U.S. State and Territory Postal Abbreviations

attr.attrdef: Latitude of the base end of the runway.
Longitude of the base end of the runway
Latitude of the reciprocal end of the runway
Longitude of the reciprocal end of the runway.
The VERSION is a 2-digit number that will be incremented for all records in the database whenever a new release is distributed.

stdorder.ordering: Call (202-366-DATA), or E-mail (answers@bts.gov) RITA/BTS to request the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008 DVD. The NTAD DVD can be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov. Individual datasets from the NTAD can also be downloaded from the Geographic Information Program web sit at http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/.
